channel.title: How do I add objects?
channel.description:
Um...yeah. This has changed from WHERE do I add objects to how. I am so confused at this point it isnt funny. I've found 2 files that both say objects on 'em and I have absolutely no idea what to do with them...but on my old server I didnt even have to go through different files, I changed/added objects through client.java....but if I can put my objects code in there, where? I am SO confused...what do I do?!
EDIT: There is a file where I think i'm supposed to put it, I need help filing it out?
//------ClsdID---XCoord--YCoord--CDir----OpenID--OpenX---OpenY---ODir (example) ObID = 1530 3260 3400 0 1531 3259 3400 -1
Object id, x coords, y coord and direction I understand, but what the hell is with the "opens?"

item.title: How do I add objects?
item.dc:creator: @damnscape damnscape
item.description:
@damnscape wrote:

client.java:1115: makeGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int) is already defined in cl
ient
public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int
tileObjectType){ // Makes Global objects
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
You have sucsessfully compiled
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

error can someone plz help me!!!
u cna get mod if you want on my server
plz help me!!!

// println_debug(“Loading finished.”);
break;

item.title: How do I add objects?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Ok heres a tut I made there now on the spot lol:
[hr]
in client.java hit ctrl+f and search “case 121:”
in between “case 121:” and “break;” add this:

                        NewObjects();

Make sure its not the attack potion case!
Now under any void add this:

        public void NewObjects() {
			//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
			//ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 

}

Now add under the } :

        public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
		for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
			if(p != null){
				client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){
				if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
					person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
	}

Now if you dont understand heres an example:

put this:

               makeGlobalObject(3027, 3350, 824, -3, 10);//defence

in your newObjects(); void so it will now look like:

        public void NewObjects() {
			//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
			//ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 
               makeGlobalObject(3027, 3350, 824, -3, 10);//defence
}

That should make a wooden defence somewhere in the small fally centre (the small one with the fountain).

Here is the layout:
makeGlobalObject(COORDX, COORDY, OBJECT ID, FACE, TYPE);//comment
[i]Remember, anything that starts with // is a comment and is ignored by the compiler

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add objects?
item.dc:creator: @Blk1 Blk_
item.description:
@Blk1 wrote:

Search your client.java for: makeglobalobject or addglobalobject or something like that. You will see something like this: makeGlobalObject(2978, 9912, 4152, -1, 10);//back portal from godwars

add (under or above) : makeGlobalObject(X-coord, Y-coord, Object-id, The way your object is facing, 10);

0 - west, 1 - south, - 2 east, 3 - north if you want to change the way your object is facing.

Read full topic
